name: Chemist
ability: You have a fusion of 2 in-play characters' abilities. Each day. privately guess which: if right, learn your ability.
firstNightReminder: Mark 2 players with the *SYNTHESISED* reminders and then decide on the Chemist's ability based on which characters are marked. If appropriate, run the ability tonight.

name: Insurrectionist
ability: Once per game, choose a player: if good, they become & learn your character. If evil guesses you (once), your team loses.
firstNightReminder: The Insurrectionist might choose a player. That player, if good, becomes an Insurrectionist & learns who recruited them. The recruiter loses their ability. :reminder:
otherNightReminder: The Insurrectionist might choose a player. That player, if good, becomes an Insurrectionist & learns who recruited them. The recruiter loses their ability. :reminder:

name: Conspiracist
ability: 1 Townsfolk receives reversed info & it moves to a Townsfolk neighbour each night, even if you die. Each night, learn which direction.
firstNightReminder: The *REVERSED INFO* :reminder: moves to 1 of the current holder's Townsfolk neighbours. *If the Conspiracist is alive*, wake them & show which direction.
otherNightReminder: The *REVERSED INFO* :reminder: moves to 1 of the current holder's Townsfolk neighbours. *If the Conspiracist is alive*, wake them & show which direction.

name: Veraxillus
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. You might have the abilities of characters you're mad you are: if so, learn this.
otherNightReminder: The Veraxillus chooses a player, who *dies*. The Veraxillus might have another ability on top of this; if so, run it at the appropriate time.

name: Absolut
ability: Townsfolk abilities yield false info except 1. Each evil may (once) publicly guess who: if right, or after day 5, evil wins.

jinxes.reason: If Absolut is in play, the Miasma reverses information instead of making it false.
If Absolut is in play, the Vortox reverses information instead of making it false.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
If Absolut is in play, Each night*, the Tactician instead learns which of their choices would benefit evil the most by sharing their information.
If Absolut is in play, the Spy does not see any reminder tokens in the Grimoire.
If Absolut is in play, the Widow does not see any reminder tokens in the Grimoire.
If Absolut is in play, the Esper does not see any reminder tokens in the Grimoire.

firstNightReminder: Mark 1 Townsfolk as the *THOUGHT CRIMINAL*. :reminder: All other Townsfolk yield false info.

name: Hysteria
ability: On day 3, the living may duel (all learns this): both learn a question & whoever fails to answer correctly 1st dies. After day 2, evil wins.
otherNightReminder: If it is dawn on day 3, announce that *Hysteria has broken out!*

jinxes.reason: If the Moonflower dies & the next player to die duelling against a good player is good, the Moonflower's team loses.
If the Ravenkeeper dies during a duel without answering, they may visit the Storyteller to use their ability.
If the Farmer dies during a duel without answering, an alive good player becomes a Farmer & is told this by the Storyteller.
If the Sage dies during a duel without answering, they may visit the Storyteller to learn that the Demon is 1 of 2 players.
If the Banshee dies during a duel without answering, their ability activates immediately.
If the Steeplejack dies during a duel without answering, they may visit the Storyteller to use their ability.
If a player the Lumberjack sees dies during a duel, the Lumberjack may visit the Storyteller to use their ability.
If the Soldier dies dueling the Hysteria, they don't. If they die otherwise, they do.
If a player chosen by the Monk last night dies dueling the Hysteria, they don't.
If a player chosen by the Innkeeper last night dies dueling the Hysteria, they don't.
If a player chosen by the Devil's Advocate dies during a duel, they don't, but no longer survive execution.
The Fencer learns that Hysteria is in play 1 day earlier.
Players who die by duels register as being executed to the Pacifist.
Each night*, the Tactician instead learns which of their choices would be better for evil to duel on the final day.
